thread.title: Spain Park's "grimy" defense set the tone
thread.title_full: Spain Park's "grimy" defense set the tone

title: Spain Park's "grimy" defense set the tone
text:
Spain Park's "grimy" defense set the tone The Class 7A No. 2 Jaguars are giving up only 11.4 points per game Published 7:38 PM CDT Oct 14, 2015 A Large Text 
From the opening kick, Spain Park's “hungry, physical, grimy” defense, as senior linebacker Perry Young described, expects disrupt its opponent. 
The Jaguars (6-1, 5-0) are ranked No. 2 in Class 7A -- thanks to a salty defense that has pitched four shutouts and has allowed only 80 points through seven games. 
"I definitely didn't expect all these shutouts, but didn't expect a lot of teams to score on us,” senior defensive lineman Markell Clark said. “Four shutouts in a season, that's great." 
The Jags play even better in region play, giving up only 8.4 points per game. In fact, the guest scoreboard might as well be a permanent blank spot, Spain Park has yet to give up a point on its home turf. 
"That first home game, putting those new black jerseys on us gained our confidence back,” Young said. “We started buying into the schemes our coaches have been working with us." 
The master minds behind the defense, coordinator Bart Sessions and third-year head coach Shawn Raney. 
"I was a high school quarterback, then went to college,” Raney said. “I threw about three passes and they moved me to defensive back. I've coached that position my entire life. I guess that's originally where it got." 
Spain Park can clinch a No. 1 seed and host a first round playoff game with a win at Oak Mountain Friday night. 
Follow Kyle Burger on Twitter: @kyle_burger
